remarks: The derivative rule for inverse functions.  If ` F ` is a continuous and differentiable bijective function from ` X ` to ` Y ` which never has derivative ` 0 ` , then ` ``' F ` is also differentiable, and its derivative is the reciprocal of the derivative of ` F ` .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 24-Feb-2015.)
